com.wm.xmldata

Class XmlDataMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wm.xmldata.XmlDataMap

  • public class XmlDataMap
extends java.lang.Object
    The XmlDataMap class allows direct manipulation of fields in an XmlData object without the use of cursors. Instead, an NSRecord is used as a template to provide positional context. In this regard, the facilities of XmlDataMap loosely emulate those of Flow Map operations such as set and drop. An XmlDataMap is created using the XmlDataMap create method, specifying a source XmlData instance, and a reference to an NSRecord that maps (describes) the data. It is possible to map nested children as well. Not all functions of the XmlDataCursor are implemented for maps. Primarily, the get, set, drop, and map families of methods are provided. In order to perform other operations, obtain an XmlDataCursor for the desired item getXmlDataCursorAt(XmlDataContentTag).

      • create

        public static XmlDataMap create(com.wm.data.IData data,
                                com.wm.lang.ns.NSRecord record)
        Create an XmlDataMap using the specified input data and NSRecord.
        Parameters:
        data - an IData in XmlData format
        record - an NSRecord
        Returns:
        a new XmlDataMap
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.ImproperDocumentType - the NSRecord is not an XmlData record or does not content any content

      • drop

        public boolean drop(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                    int... index)
        Remove the item at the specified tag and index. If repeating values are present, an index must be specified. If the item is a scalar the index must be zero or not specified.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag to be removed
        index - the offset into repeating values. If the last repeating value is removed, the entire entry (including the tag) is removed.
        Returns:
        true if the tag was present and the specified item was removed; false if the tag was not present
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record

      • dropObject

        public boolean dropObject(XmlDataContentTag memberTag)
        Remove the item at the specified tag. The entire object is removed whether it is a scalar or an array.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag of the item to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the tag was present and the specified item was removed; false if the tag was not present
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record

      • getItem

        public java.lang.Object getItem(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                                int... index)
        Retrieves a single item stored at the specified tag. A null is returned if the tag is not present. If repeating values are present, an index must be specified. If an indirect item is present, the entire any-item or substitution-item is returned. Use the getValue(XmlDataContentTag, int...) method to obtain the value of an indirect-item.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag for which data is retrieved. This must be an element-tag, a substitution-tag, an any-tag, or a group-tag.
        index - the index if repeating items are present.
        Returns:
        the value or null if the tag is not found.
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange - when the index exceeds the number of repeating elements or the maxOccurs of the mapped field
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record

      • getItem

        public java.lang.Object getItem(XmlDataContentTag[] tags)
        Return the item specified by a path using a list of XmlDataContentTags
        Parameters:
        tags - the list of XmlDataContentTags
        Returns:
        the value stored at the path item

      • getContent

        public java.lang.Object getContent(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                                   int... index)
        Returns the content at the specified tag as if the XmlDataCursor getContent() method was invoked. For complex-values, content does not include attributes.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag of the member item for which content is returned
        index - the offset into the list of repeating values.
        Returns:
        the value at the specified tag; null if the tag is not found
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange - when the index exceeds the number of repeating elements or the maxOccurs of the mapped field
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record
        XmlDataException.FormatError - when the value is not in complex-value format

      • getData

        public com.wm.data.IData getData()
        Returns the data mapped by this XmlDataMap. Normally this will be the same value passed into the create() method. However, if a null value is passed into create, this method will create a new IData instance in the appropriate XmlData format.
        Returns:
        the IData or null if none has been created.

      • getParentValueTag

        public XmlDataContentTag getParentValueTag()
        Returns the tag associated with the currently mapped parent. Normally, this is the same name as the parent that is mapped. However, if the parent is a substitution tag or any tag, the returned tag is the actual tag that is present in the instance data.
        Returns:
        the tag present in the instance data.

      • getObject

        public java.lang.Object getObject(XmlDataContentTag memberTag)
        Retrieves the entire object stored at the specified tag. A null is returned if the tag is not present. If repeating values are present, the entire array is returned.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag for which data is retrieved. This must be an element-tag, a substitution-tag, an any-tag, or a group-tag.
        Returns:
        the value or null if the tag is not found.
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record

      • getPath

        public XmlDataContentTag[] getPath()
        Create an XmlData path (an array of XmlDataContentTags) from the current map. If no children have been mapped at the time of invocation, an empty array is returned.
        Returns:
        an XmlDataContentTag[] of indicating the path from the root to the current child

      • getValue

        public java.lang.Object getValue(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                                 int... index)
        Returns the value at the specified tag. The value is returned as if the XmlDataCursor getValue() method was invoked. Consequently, the effective value of substitution-items and any-items is transparently extracted from the indirect-item stored at the tag. Use the getItem() method to retrieve the entire item rather than the effective value of the any-item. For element-tags and group-tags, getItem() and getValue() behave identically.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag for which the value is returned.
        index - the offset into the list of repeating values.
        Returns:
        the value at the specified tag; null if the tag is not found
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange - when the index exceeds the number of repeating elements or the maxOccurs of the mapped field
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record

      • getValue

        public java.lang.Object getValue(XmlDataContentTag[] tags)
        Get the value of an item using a list of XmlDataContentTags as the path
        Parameters:
        tags - the list of XmlDataContentTags
        Returns:
        the value of the item

      • getValue

        public java.lang.Object getValue(java.lang.String path)
        Get the value of an item specified using a String path
        Parameters:
        path - the patch
        Returns:
        the value of the path item

      • getValueTag

        public XmlDataContentTag getValueTag(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                                     int... index)
        Retrieve the value-tag from the item with the specified tag. When the specified tag is an element-tag or a group-tag, the value-tag is the same as the specified tag. When the specified tag is an any-tag ir a substitution-tag, the value-tag of the associated indirect-item is returned..
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the content-tag for which the search is performed
        index - the offset into the list of repeating values
        Returns:
        the value-tag of the specified item.
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange - when the index exceeds the number of repeating elements or the maxOccurs of the mapped field
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record

      • getXmlDataCursorAt

        public XmlDataCursor getXmlDataCursorAt(XmlDataContentTag memberTag)
        Returns an XmlDataCursor positioned on the specified tag. If the tag is not present, the cursor is unpositioned. Note that the cursor is obtained from the currently mapped IData. If the specified tag exists in the mapped IData, a positioned cursor is returned regardless of the type of data stored at the tag. Contrast this behavior with map() which can only succeed if the specified tag contains complex content. If this Map is in effect for a parent that does not yet exist (i.e. a non-existing field was mapped from the parent), a null is returned.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the XmlDataContentTag
        Returns:
        a positioned cursor if tag is present; an unpositioned cursor if tag doesn't exist; null if parent not yet created

      • insertItemAfter

        public void insertItemAfter(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                            java.lang.Object value,
                            int index)
        Inserts an object into a repeating value list at the specified tag. An index is required if more than one value is present Because the data is new, in must be properly formatted (i.e. insertValue is not possible)
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag at which a repeating value is inserted
        value - the object that is inserted
        index - the offset into the repeating values list
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange - when the index exceeds the number of repeating elements or the maxOccurs of the mapped field
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - if the specified field is not defined in the current map.

      • insertItemBefore

        public void insertItemBefore(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                             java.lang.Object value,
                             int index)
        Inserts an object into a repeating value list at the specified tag. An index is required if more than one value is already present Because the data is new, in must be properly formatted (i.e. insertValue is not possible)
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag at which a repeating value is inserted
        value - the object that is inserted
        index - the offset into the list
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange - when the index exceeds the number of repeating elements or the maxOccurs of the mapped field
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - if the specified field is not defined in the current map.

      • insertValueAndTagAfter

        public void insertValueAndTagAfter(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                                   XmlDataElementTag valueTag,
                                   java.lang.Object value,
                                   int index)
        Inserts a value into a repeating value list at a specified tag. If the specified tag is an any-tag or a substitution-tag, the appropriate indirect-item is created from the value and value-tag and inserted into the array at the specified tag and index. For element-tags and group-tags, the value-tag must be identical to the specified tag, or specified as null. An index is required if more than one value is present
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag for which a repeating value is inserted
        value - the value inserted
        valueTag - the tag of the value
        index - the offset into the repeating value list
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange - when the index exceeds the number of repeating elements or the maxOccurs of the mapped field
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record

      • insertValueAndTagBefore

        public void insertValueAndTagBefore(XmlDataContentTag objectTag,
                                    XmlDataElementTag valueTag,
                                    java.lang.Object value,
                                    int index)
        Inserts a value into a repeating value list at a specified tag. If the specified tag is an any-tag or a substitution-tag, the appropriate indirect-item is created from the value and value-tag and inserted into the array at the specified tag and index. For element-tags and group-tags, the value-tag must be identical to the specified tag, or specified as null. An index is required if more than one value is present
        Parameters:
        objectTag - the tag for which a repeating value is inserted
        valueTag - the tah of the value
        value - the value inserted
        index - the offset into the list of repeating values
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange - when the index exceeds the number of repeating elements or the maxOccurs of the mapped field
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record

      • isChildMapable

        public boolean isChildMapable(XmlDataContentTag memberTag)
        Indicates whether the specified field is mappable. This is based on the field definition in the associated NSRecord, not the actual content.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag to be tested
        Returns:
        true if field is mappable
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record

      • map

        public boolean map(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                   int... index)
        Create a new XmlDataMap of the specified child, pushing the current map onto an internal stack. The map succeeds even if the mapped tag is not yet present in the input, thus making it possible to create a new item and add members to it.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag of the child that is mapped
        index - the offset into repeating child values; if the content tgg has an index, this value overrides it.
        Returns:
        true if the mapped child already exists in the pipeline, false if it has not yet been created
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record
        XmlDataException.ImproperDocumentType - the NSRecord is not an XmlData record or does not content any content

      • map

        public boolean map(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                   XmlDataContentTag qualifierTag,
                   int... index)
        Create a new XmlDataMap of the specified child, pushing the current map onto an internal stack. The map succeeds even if the mapped tag is not yet present in the input, thus making it possible to create a new item and add members to it. If the child is an indirect-item and does not yet exist, an indirect-qualifier must be specified.
        Parameters:
        memberTag- - the tag of the child that is mapped
        qualifierTag - the indirect-qualifier for the indirect-item
        index - the offset into repeating child values; if the content tgg has an index, this value overrides it.
        Returns:
        true if the mapped child already exists in the pipeline, false if it has not yet been created

      • map

        public int map(XmlDataContentTag[] tags)
        Performs a nested map for each tag in the list, effectively navigating to a lower level in the tree.
        Parameters:
        tags - a list of XmlDataContentTags
        Returns:
        the number of levels through which the map has descended.

      • map

        public int map(java.lang.String path)
        Performs a nested map by navigating from the current map to the specified child along a path specified by a String. If any of the tags correspond to repeating values, an indexed form of the path String must be used. If the path string uses namespace-qualified tags, the path must include the :{ ... } namespace preamble, or the default namespace may must be set using the setDefaultNamespaceMap.
        Parameters:
        path - the path specified as a String
        Returns:
        the number of levels through which the map descends
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record
        XmlDataException.ImproperDocumentType - the NSRecord is not an XmlData record or does not content any content

      • mapExisting

        public boolean mapExisting(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                           int... index)
        Performs a map of the specified tag and index if it exists. Returns true if the mapped tag exists in the instance.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag to map
        index - the offset into the list if repeating values
        Returns:
        true if the item exists
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record
        XmlDataException.ImproperDocumentType - the NSRecord is not an XmlData record or does not content any content

      • mapExisting

        public boolean mapExisting(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                           XmlDataContentTag qualifierTag,
                           int... index)
        Performs a map of the specified tag, index, and indirect-qualifier.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag to map
        qualifierTag - the indirect-qualifier
        index - the index
        Returns:
        true if the item exists

      • mapExisting

        public int mapExisting(boolean allowPartial,
                       XmlDataContentTag[] tags)
        Performs a nested map for each tag in the list, effectively navigating to a lower level in the tree. The mapping may be partial if allowPartial is true. When allowPartial is true, the returned integer indicates the number of existing steps that were mapped.
        Parameters:
        tags - a list of XmlDataContentTags
        allowPartial - a value of true indicates that mapping may succeed if part of the path exists. A value of false indicates that entire path must exist
        Returns:
        the number of levels through which the map has descended.
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record
        XmlDataException.ImproperDocumentType - the NSRecord is not an XmlData record or does not content any content

      • mapExisting

        public int mapExisting(boolean allowPartial,
                       java.lang.String path)
        Only maps a field that exists in the instance. This method produces the same results as mapExisting(boolean, XmlDataContentTag[]) but allows the path to be expressed in String form.
        Parameters:
        allowPartial - indicates that a partially existing path is acceptable
        path - the path expressed as a String
        Returns:
        the number of steps mapped

      • parent

        public boolean parent(int... num)
        Return to a parent map by popping the current XMlDataMap from the internal stack.
        Parameters:
        num - the number of levels to pop. The default is 1.
        Returns:
        true if the number of specified levels has been popped.

      • setItem

        public void setItem(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                    java.lang.Object value,
                    int... index)
        Set the item associated with the specified member tag. When repeating values are present at the member tag, an index must be specified. For element-tags and group-tags the values are the typical values: IDatas and Strings. setItem() and setValue() behave identically for group-tags and element-tag. For substitution-tags, the value must be a substitution-tem such as the object constructed using the convenience method XmlData.createSubstitutionItem(XmlDataElementTag, Object). For any-tags, the value must be an any-item, such the object constructed using the convenience method XmlData.createAnyItem(XmlDataContentTag, Object).
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag for which a formatted values is set
        value - the formatted value assigned (must match the tag usage)
        index - offset into the repeating value list
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange - when the index exceeds the number of repeating elements or the maxOccurs of the mapped field
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record

      • setItem

        public void setItem(XmlDataContentTag[] tags,
                    java.lang.Object value)
        Performs a setItem() of formatted value by navigating from the current map to the specified child along a path specified by a list of content tags. If any of the tags correspond to repeating values, an indexed form of the content tag must be used.
        Parameters:
        tags - the list of tags that defines the path to the item that is set
        value - the formatted value that is set

      • setItem

        public void setItem(java.lang.String path,
                    java.lang.Object value)
        Performs a setItem() of formatted value by navigating from the current map to the specified child along a path specified by a String. If any of the tags correspond to repeating values, an indexed form of the path String must be used. If the path string uses namespace-qualified tags, the path must include the :{ ... } namespace preamble, or the default namespace may must be set using the setDefaultNamespaceMap.
        Parameters:
        path - the String form of the path to the item that is set
        value - the formatted value that is set

      • setDefaultNamespaceMap

        public void setDefaultNamespaceMap(XmlNamespaceMap map)
        Sets the namespace map used by namespace-qualified String paths
        Parameters:
        map - the XmlNamespace map.

      • setDefaultNamespaceMap

        public void setDefaultNamespaceMap(java.lang.String pairs)
        Sets the namespace map used to resolve namespace-qualified String paths.
        Parameters:
        pairs - a String in the form "prefix1 namespace1 prefix2 namespace2 ..."

      • setObject

        public void setObject(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                      java.lang.Object obj)
        Sets the object at the specified tag. The entire object is replaced. This method makes it possible to replace a repeating value with a scalar value, or a scalar value with a repeating value. No index is allowed.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag for which the value is set. For group-tags, any-tags, and substitution-tags, the content must be IData or IData[]. For element-tags, the content may be String, String[], IData, IData[], or Object[].
        obj - the object stored at the tag
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record

      • setValue

        public void setValue(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                     java.lang.Object value,
                     int... index)
        Sets the value stored at the specified tag. If repeating values are present, an index must be specified. The value is stored "as is" but must be compatible with the memberTag. A value must be a String or IData for elements tags. It must be an IData for group-tags. For an any-tag, the any-item must already be present unless it can be constructed from an indirect-qualifier tag. For a substitution-tag, a substitution-item must already be present unless it can be constructed from an indirect-qualifier tag. The index must be less than the number of items already present in order to replace an existing item. The index may be equal to the number of repeating items which causes the list to be extended by one value. It is not allowed to specify an index greater than the number of repeating items present, or specify a number greater than or equal to the maxOccurs property of the field.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the tag who's value is set
        value - the single value stored at the tag
        index - offset into the repeating value list
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange - when the index exceeds the number of repeating elements or the maxOccurs of the mapped field
        XmlDataException.FormatError - if the value does not exist (unless it can be constructed from an indirect-qualifier tag)
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified field is not defined in the mapping record.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(XmlDataContentTag[] tags,
                     java.lang.Object value)
        Performs a setValue() by navigating from the current map to the specified child along a path specified by a list of content tags. If any of the tags correspond to repeating values, an indexed form of the content tag must be used.
        Parameters:
        tags - path expressed as an array of tags
        value - the value to be set

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.String path,
                     java.lang.Object value)
        Performs a setValue() by navigating from the current map to the specified child along a path specified by a String. If any of the tags correspond to repeating values, an indexed form of the path String must be used. If the path string uses namespace-qualified tags, the path must include the :{ ... } namespace preamble, or the default namespace may must be set using the setDefaultNamespaceMap.
        Parameters:
        path - path expressed as String
        value - the value to be set

      • setValueAndTag

        public void setValueAndTag(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                           XmlDataContentTag valueTag,
                           java.lang.Object value,
                           int... index)
        Set the value and value-tag of the specified indirect-item. If repeating values are present an index must be specified. This method is useful only when the item tag is an any-tag or a substitution-tag, implying that the associated value is an indirect-item.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the indirect-tag of the item for which the value and value-tag is set
        valueTag - the value-tag that is set for the indirect-item
        value - value assigned to the indirect-item
        index - index into repeating value
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange - when the index exceeds the number of repeating elements or the maxOccurs of the mapped field
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record
        XmlDataException.TagConflict - when invoked on anything other than an XmlDataSubstitutionTag or XmlDataAnyTag

      • setValueTag

        public void setValueTag(XmlDataContentTag memberTag,
                        XmlDataElementTag valueTag,
                        int... index)
        Set the value-tag of the specified indirect-item. If repeating values are present an index must be specified. This method is useful only when the item tag is an any-tag or a substitution-tag, and thus has an indirect-item as its value. Unlike many other map operations, the item must exist in order for this operation to succeed because only the value-tah is changing, the value is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        memberTag - the indirect-tag of the item who's value-tag is changed
        valueTag - the new value-tag
        index - offset into repeating values
        Throws:
        XmlDataException.IndexOutOfRange - when the index exceeds the number of repeating elements or the maxOccurs of the mapped field
        XmlDataException.UnknownField - when the specified tag is not defined in the mapping record
        XmlDataException.TagConflict - when invoked on anything other than an XmlDataSubstitutionTag or XmlDataAnyTag
